executiveSummary: Ramone Vanir and his co-founder Kevin O'Pur pitched their company Genius Litter, a color-changing, health-monitoring cat litter, seeking $250,000 for 4% equity. After multiple offers and counteroffers, they secured a deal with three sharks — Mark Cuban, Lori Greiner, and Kevin O’Leary — for $250,000 in exchange for 10% equity plus 2% advisory shares.
keyDecisions: A final investment deal was reached with Mark Cuban, Lori Greiner, and Kevin O’Leary for $250,000 for 10% equity plus 2% advisory shares.

actionItems.task: Collaborate with Mark Cuban, Lori Greiner, and Kevin O’Leary to scale Genius Litter’s brand and expand market presence.
Develop and launch the two new products discussed: a health-indicating litter topper and a color-changing dog pee pad.

nextSteps: Ramone and Kevin will begin working with the three sharks to enhance distribution, build the brand, and accelerate growth in both retail and direct-to-consumer channels.
